> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Are tests run concurrently
> 
> 
> Hi all,
> I've been looking to check that Junit runs tests serially, 
> i.e. one at a  time, I've been told that there are occasions 
> when JUnit runs tests concurrently, is this so? I can't see 
> how this would be, as tests which access the DB would almost 
> certainly fail if they were run conrrently. Thanks in advance 
> for any help, Oisin
> 

You are correct for the general case of JUnit's execution framework.
JUnit out of the box runs tests serially.  There are some add-ons and
tools such as JUnitPerf http://www.clarkware.com/ and Enhanced Junit
www.javatesting.com/Product/enhancedjunit that will run tests
concurrently on multiple threads, and in the case of Enhanced Junit
multiple JVMs, but you'll know it if you're using them.
